description:
This is a "mom & pop" eatery operated by one person who made probably the best turkey sub sandwich I ever had.  The place itself is small and unassuming; it's full of wall-to-wall plants, a bit dingy, and have a few tables for eat-in customers.  The menu isn't too big but that's probably why the sandwiches are so good.

I stopped by this past weekend for a quick bite; opened the front door and there were already three customers ahead of me.  The interior could use a face-lift and some remodeling.

To my surprise, there's only one person working there on a Friday evening.  He took the customers' order, rang them up, and made the sandwiches all by himself with an oven no bigger than an Easy Bake oven. 

I order the turkey sandwich which includes all the fixings (it comes with lettuce, cheese, tomatoes, etc., unless you specify).  He made the sandwich and place it into this small oven for approximately 2 minutes.  Out pops the sandwich all warm with the French bread crisped to perfection.  I ordered my sandwich to go as I walked towards Embarcadero but my sandwich never made it; it was so good that I couldn't stop eating it!  I couldn't believe my taste buds.

The sandwich cost $7.95 plus tax.  In my opinion, the sandwich was much tastier than the big chain sub shops.
author: Vvn W.

description:
I've been going here since high school (circa 1983) and their teriyaki beef sandwich is the best in the world.  Yes, the decor is outdated; yes, the interior needs a facelift; but I'm going there for the sandwich and nothing else. It's literally a "mom and pop" place and if you blink your eyes, you've missed the entire shop.  There's nothing at all from the outside that looks inviting.  Then again, the "hole in the wall" places seem to be the best. 
 If you're a local San Franciscan, you'll know this place; if you're a tourist or just visiting, stop on in and order the teriyaki beef sandwich.  I promise, you won't be disappointed.
author: Marlo C.

description:
I ordered the Italian sausage sandwich. It was pretty good! It was by my hotel so I wanted to try something close by to be able to eat in. I found this place in Yelp, so I wanted to try it. Luckily I came in the right time to order before they close. 
The cheese from the sandwich was really good because it was melted too! It was nice sandwich to go with chips and a drink!
author: Carola S.

description:
I'll be honest here, the subs blew my mind.  

My dad took me here for lunch and the place was empty.  Tons of fake plants, old tables, and looks sloppy.  My first impression was "meh" It had that old family business kind of feel.  When I looked at the prices, I was shocked, but expected the San Fransisco prices.  

Got their famous Viking Sub, and my god, it was great: salami, pastrami, ham, cheese and there was this seasoning, I think it was just seasoning salt, but it pushed it over the top after they toasted it.

I did NOT expect it to be good, and when I looked at the Yelp ratings I instantly knew this place was a gem that people typically walk past.  It's sad how many tourists probably walk past this place to pay for expensive sub par food elsewhere.  

I can imagine regulars line up here since when I went it was raining and after 2.

Advice:  keep those sandwiches UNCHANGED.  Maybe swap out the decorations and replace the furniture.  But really, that's not even needed.  Why spend the money on those extras when people most likely just grab and go.  It's nice to keep that family business feel.  Don't see much of it in SF anymore.

(This review started as a 4 star, but as I wrote, I had to change it to a 5: the sub was just that good)
author: Nathan S.

description: Definitely wouldn't come back. Way over-priced. $13 after tax for a large sandwich? The amount of meat inside is pretty skimpy as well. I know the rent is SF is high but I feel like this woman is gouging the customers with her prices. $2.50 for a can of soda?
author: Clint M.

description:
Sandwiches are pretty simple but tasty nonetheless. I tried the crab salad sandwich which was not bad considering I had fresh king crab the night before. It just felt a little lackluster considering all the good sandwiches you can get for $10 in the Marina. A large is almost twice as much as a small. 

Service was okay, but I was the only one in the shop at the time. The interior is very old and not the best atmosphere to dine in, but take it to go and enjoy! 

Food: 3.5/5
Value: 3.25/5
Service: 3.5/5
Overall: 3.5/5
author: Brian G.

description:
Delicious, simple, generous portions.
The definition of a hole-in-the-wall, cozy interior, friendly staff.
author: Robin H.

description: Menu has 2 options for sandwich sizes.  Being out on work field, building up my appetite for a BLT sandwich from Vikings.  Was already eating the first half of my sandwich and out of curiosity.  Looked in my sandwich to see how much bacon was in it.  Surprise to me and smh too!  Let the owners know about this and she just shrugs her shoulder.  Classic move!!
author: Jeffrey P.

description: I'm sorry but the sandwiches are sub-par. I've tried it three times and I'm not going back. The cheap ingredients would be fine if the prices matched.
author: Manny F.

description:
I readily admit that 4 stars may be too high a rating for the actual subway sandwich, but Vikings pulled a supremely effective shock-and-awe attack on my taste buds. And so relative to expectations (even those heightened by the consistently high yelp reviews), this rating is completely justified.

Vikings is a small hole-in-the-wall place that has none of the antiseptic average-ness of the big subway chains, nor the pretentious hip-ness of a more niche local one. You enter Vikings and it's no frills: 2 person operation, small seating area, quick counter service, focused menu. So when we ordered the tuna sub and the crab salad sub, I was expecting just to satiate my hunger. Vikings did that and more because the subs were fantastic!
- Portions were big: a small sub will leave your belly exploding, a large one will be enough to satisfy 2 people).
- Fillings were generous: Lots of garnishes/veggies are expected given they're good fillers; Vikings made sure to load up on the tuna and crab meat as well.
- The bread: This was undoubtedly the star of the show, and not in a bad way. When the bread is what you praise about a sandwich, that's usually a back-handed complement and an extremely bad sign. Vikings though uses the bread to differentiate its subs and take them to another level. The bread was toasted perfectly - crispy on the edges with just the right amount of toastiness to not get weighed down and soggy with the sauce/garnishes.

Vikings subway sandwiches as a culinary delight - who knew?!
author: David Y.

description:
Trying there pastrami. 8.63 with tax. A good spot for the hotels for a quick bite!

This review is for the kind owner who let me use the restroom in exchange for purchasing food on my break, Which is fair since the subs are priced better than subway. And the resto is nice and clean! I felt like i could live here.

They have canned drinks which are bit pricey but if you dont have any other options 2.50$

Alot of plants.
author: jerrell m.

description: She handled a lot of cash before taking my order- then proceeded to make the sandwiches without washing her hands or wear gloves- and it took forever to wait- super overpriced- go somewhere else
author: Ed Y.

description:
Once again a ton of older reviews shape the overall Yelp rating...and that is not a help to any of us counting on yelp to direct us to Good experiences.

The Viking Giant Subs is a hole in the wall place that serves a very mediocre and pricey sandwich. I ordered a small tuna sub...$8. The maker of the sando didn't ask me if I wanted cheese or toasted ( no to both) . It came that way.

Please ask your patrons how they want it.

The lettuce was wilted and old.

The sandwich was just average at best and many places make a much better sandwhich.

 I would not comeback nor make a special trip to try this place.
author: David G.

description: A little gem. I had a small turkey and cheese and it was perfect. Hot out of the oven. I will definitely be back.
author: Jeremy D.

description: Good bread.  I had a tasty meatball. The small was plenty.  I will be eating here again.
author: Matthew D.

description:
When I was a kid this was the only place you could get a toasted Tuna sandwich.  Every time I come into San Francisco I have to get one.  It's a simple place, cheap prices and always a great sandwich. Toasted seeded French bread with fresh tuna salad (carrots and junk), a great Italian type dressing mayo combo and melted provolone.  

Simple, cheap and delicious!
author: Shaunt N.

description: Horrible customer service. First, a woman came in behind us and asked to use the bathroom, but was told there wasn't one. Then my friend asked to use the bathroom and she was told where it was. Then, they charged my boyfriend for a large sub, but only gave him a small. And on top of all that, I ordered my sub with no dressing and only found out after leaving that it had dressing on it. I would have gone back, but I knew the woman working would not have cared and would have probably told me that I ordered it with dressing. I will not be back.
author: Kat J.

description: So good! Bread is so tasty and fresh. Crunchy in just the right way. The owner was there and super nice and it's right down from the famous part of Lombard street
author: Devin R.

description: This is a "hole in the wall" sub place that makes amazing sub sandwiches. I had the Avocado with cheese and it was delicious. Hot and toasty and tasted great. I think the bread is big part of it, because it was nice and crusty on the outside and soft inside. I haven't had such a good sandwich in years since I moved from Boulder where there are comparable subs at Snarf's. I also had the potato salad which had a nice flavor of mustard and a bit tangy.
author: Alexandra B.

description:
The gentleman friendly and did not rush me when I examined the menu board and was able to answer my questions.  I think he was the owner...this is a small little  sandwich shop.

I ordered tbe large pastrami.  It was a toasted sandeuch on a seeded roll.  Good flavor,  but tbe meat was chewy.

**note $10 minimum for credit card.

Parking could be difficult in this touristy area.
author: Jerry W.

description: This sub shop didn't look that nice overall but the sandwiches were delicious! We had an order of 8 sandwiches and they did all of our special orders that we took to go for a nice picnic. The bread was very good toasted on every sandwich!
author: Angela E.

description:
Family owned small sub shop. Subs are good and consistent every time. 

Shop is always clean. Nice owners/operators
author: Gurpreet K.

description:
I love their sandwiches here because it's not overwhelmingly big. My husband introduced me to this spot back in 2012 and I loved it!

This place is tiny and during lunch time, it can get a little packed. People usually order their sandwiches and eat it elsewhere. 

They toast their yummy sesame bread to perfection, they usually use the right amount of sauce and I love that they have vegetarian options. We usually order the avocado sandwich and I love it. Wish they had more vegan options though.
author: Reese E.

description: Best sub in San Francisco. The Mighty Viking sub is soooooooooo good. Do it. Trust me.
author: Paul R.

description:
This place is simple from the outside, but everything changes when you step inside. Simply put, that was one of the best subs I've had in a long time! No doubt I felt like a Viking eating here.

Upon walking into this little shop that sits on the corner of Van Ness and Lombard, I instantly went on a time trip back to the 90's (Adam- who wrote a review as well) said it best. The place is simplistic- you have your basic table setup that you can find at typical delis, San Francisco decor on the walls, and my personal favorite: business cards! You know this place is old school when you have old business cards hung up for advertisement. These are all things that I love because it's not what's mainstream anymore these days. 

On to the food!

It's simplistic yet delicious. The pastrami is tasty as can be, the vegetables are all fresh, and the size of the sub is awesome! Though everything here may seem like an average place to get an average sub, it's really not. This thing is incredibly yummy. The use of the sesame bun is great, and it's toasted to perfection. Everything really melts in your mouth.

Service here is fantastic too. There seem to be two main people who make all the subs (my best guess is husband and wife) and they are friendly. Today was a more packed day for them and they still were putting out subs every few minutes and the line was never held up. 

Final verdict: if you love old school vibes that take you back in time, good service and amazing subs, this place is for you. Plus, you really do feel like a Viking eating here- if you want to be a Viking, make your way over here now!
author: Alex B.

description:
Alright, maybe it's because I am an actual Viking that I love this place so much.  (Scandinavian on both sides of the family, and raised in Minnesota - which is basically the 6th Scandinavian Country)  Maybe it's because I have a soft spot for places that remind me of growing up in the 80's and 90's - this place hasn't seen a remodel anytime recently, and I hope it doesn't any time soon.  Or, maybe, they just have good subs.

I won't claim that they are reinventing the wheel.  Nor would I say this is a destination spot.  You've got fairly straight-forward toasted subs.  They've got all the standards:  Ham, Turkey, Roast Beef, Pastrami, Salami, Tuna, Meatball.  Then they have some of their own special varieties:  Teriyaki Beef or Chicken, Crab Salad (definitely surimi, which is fine in this Viking's book), BBQ Beef, and the "Mighty Viking" which is made with Ham, Salami and Pastrami.  All of the sandwiches come standard with Lettuce, Tomato, Onion, Dressing and Mayo.  Choice of American, Provolone or Swiss.  It comes on a toasted Sesame Roll. which is both flavorful, light and has a good crispness to it, even when you get take-out.  All the subs come in small (about 8", generally $6.75 or $8.50 depending on the sandwich) and large (about 12" and $9.75 or $11.50).  A small is plenty for lunch.  The large is a good amount of food, and you can do half for lunch and save the other half even if you're a hungry Viking.

Overall the quality is solid.  All of the meat and fixins are good.  The service is very friendly and quick - I may be wrong, but it's always the same two people working and it seems like they may be the owners.  In addition to the subs, they also have a few deli items and deserts, and do sell beer by the bottle.  There are a few tables inside, and like I said, this place has that late 80's/early 90's vibe.  You could imagine this place next door to an old-style video rental shop.  I love it.

(Now Just a Funny Experience as a Bonus)  I've frequently seen High School/slightly post-High School age kids come in around lunch since Galileo High School is pretty close.  I came in one workday afternoon and skater bro was with his friend and was trying to do an on the spot Yelp review about how much he loved Viking's Giant Subs.  The following is my recreation:  "Bro, this s*** is so f***ing dank.  I f***ing love it bro.  You're getting the meatball sub? That s*** is hella-dank.  F*** bro.  Now I don't f***ing know what I want bro,  S***'s F***ing Dank, bro.  Hella-dank."

It is hella-dank, bro.  Viking-style.
author: Adam S.

description: Meh, ordered the Viking and it tasted good but had 3 small pieces of meat on it and for a large sub it wasn't enough.
author: Patti P.

description: Ordered the roast beef sandwich.  The sandwich was HUGE!  And the bread was toasted, so it stayed hot during the whole meal.  I would come back.
author: Scott W.

description: This is the best shop around, seriously the best. I'm from Boston and ate the best sub I have ever encountered, salami ham and pastrami! Super nice !
author: Sam S.

description:
What a pleasant surprise in a city so full of expenses.  Visiting the Bay Area can be quite a wallop to your pocketbook so finding great food at a good price is a treat.  This little sandwich shop was a treat indeed.

I had the Italian with salami and potato salad.  I was expecting a cold sub, but this was so much better.  A toasty sandwich perfectly made with just the right amount of filling and dressings.  If that wasn't enough, the potato salad was perfection.  A mustard lovers dream.  Tangy, with chunks of red potatoes, celery, carrots, chopped egg and pickles.  All this for the same price you'd pay at a crappy cookie cutter chain.  Try them yourself and see.
author: Sue D.

description: Viking Subs is dangerously close to my apartment and they're so darn good. The toasted sesame bread is so good, a nice break from the typical SF sourdough. It's also decently priced for an SF sandwich. I always get the turkey sandwich and am never disappointed. No crazy sandwiches or flavors but I think the simplicity of it makes it so great.
author: Meg H.

description:
Yum!!

The service here is excellent and the food is awesome. I loved my Vietnamese sandwich and the price was great! I will be back for sure!
author: Steph L.

description: Food was great, make sure they hear your order. I had the Pizza Sub 6 inch and it filled me up. If I come back to San Fran again and this place is open, I'd come again. Reasonably priced for the city too.
author: Aaron W.

description: This place represents a true honest deal near the heart of San Francisco's tourist zone.  In our family of 5, the atmosphere feedback ranged from odd to cool.  Small deli with ~8 tables, not updated, but with a very nice gentleman  (owner?) doing all the jobs and serving great sandwiches for bargain prices (for the area).  Less than $50 fed five people, including 3 big eaters.  Try the Viking sub or hot Polish sausage sub.  Macaroni salad great too.
author: Chris S.

description: You'll probably see many Indian folks going crazy over this place. We usually order a veggie sandwich. It's really cheeesy. And veggies, well I think adding more would be good. However the sandwiches are realllllly good!
author: Disha B.

description:
Let's cut to the chase, average sub on great toasted bread. All the 4 and 5 stars ratings are definitely giving this sub shop too much praise. This is a sub of decent quality but the toasted bread makes the sub. 

Old school ambiance equals an interior that hasn't been renovated in years but that's okay. The restaurant is definitely clean enough to eat at. I wouldn't make a special trip but it beats eating at a chain sandwich shop.
author: Philip C.

description:
I had the "Italian" sausage. It was a little bit difficult communicating that I wanted marinara to the guy that was taking my order, but the gal making it understood me. The flavor was a bit "sub"-par ha ha, but I'll come back to try something else. The bread might have been good if it weren't soppy. The sausage was not spicy or even Italian sausage for that matter.

I get the sense the place is geared towards the locals who likely get a steep discount. However it was close to my hotel, so maybe worth it.
author: Doug B.

description: Great subs and potato/macaroni salad - quality ingredients combine to make a delicious sandwich and side!
author: Ana M.

description: Unbelievably, almost provocatively bad subs. $7.65 buys you two miserly slices of meat, some anemic lettuce and tomato, rubbery cheese, and a roll that seems toasted to disguise its preexisting staleness. I want to root for a local sub shop, but this place is just plain bad.
author: Lisa O.

description:
If you're not familiar with the area then you could pass this place straight without blinking an eye. It's nothing special on the outside and pretty old-school-cool on the inside. There are 90s pics of San Francisco hung around the tables and there's only one person who works in the deli. 

The menu is simple and to the point and the prices are reasonable. One cooler with a variety of drinks that are suitable for anyone. There's also some dessert options in the color but i forewent that option since this second cooler looked a little sketchy. 

I ordered a turkey sub and my bf ordered the salami sub. We both loved them! The sandwich was simple yet tasted like it had been crafted by the sub gods. The bread was perfectly crisp and the ingredients were melted just right. My portions felt generous and I left the place feeing satisfied. 

Pro Tip: If you're looking for a reason to come to the area to try this sub then might I suggest making a day out of it. Climb the stairs to Coit Tower and then walk to Lombard St to see the winding driveway. You'll get an amazing workout, great photo opportunities and it'll leave you hungry.
author: Priya S.

description: killer killer meatball subs...ran across the street for a sub during halftime...got to see the warriors lose to Houston in Oakland AND have one of the best meatball subs ever...love this little sub shop...the bread is fantastic too!
author: Kevin G.

description: This has that traditional submarine taste fast service with a real honest price. They offer sides like cold salads chips and drinks. Nice place to pick up a lunch and head to Pier 39 and eat. Owners remember regulars and are very attentive which is nice.
author: Weyland W.

description: Best sandwich place in SF hands down! Large Avocado FTW for all the vegetarians out there!
author: Shivam P.

description: Still my go to sandwich place in the marina. I always get the turkey avocado with mayonnaise and mustard. My order always come out right. The secret dressing is to die for, and how it's toasted makes it even better. The service is always friendly and usually fast, about 10 minutes since it is super busy. Love this place!!
author: Teal M.

description:
Great toasted subs. Chicken teriyaki is really tasty. Place is nothing fancy with only a couple of tables but convenient for take out. It's never really too crowded either which is nice.

They do offer wheat bread on request but it's only with a small sub. The credit card minimum is $10.
author: Zoher Z.

description: Fot me this was a waste of a complete of money. I ordered the pastrami ham and salami sandwich and it basically had 2 pieces of salami a very small almost unnoticeable amount of pastrami and maybe apiece of ham this sandwich was all bread . I would never recommend this place unless u want bread and lettuce
author: Shaun S.

description: Biting into the sandwich with the ferocity of a cheetah on a wounded gazelle, I was astounded by the mass amounts of flavor that rocked my world... that was about 19 years ago and I will not have my sub any other way! NO KISS-ASS service just SOLID sandwiches!!! VIKING'S PLEASE DONT EVER CHANGE!
author: Ghulam R.

description: Awesome standard subs. No frills or fancy shmancy hipstery sauces over here. The subs are simple and delicious. It definitely fits the bill if you're looking for a hole-in-the-wall restaurant with tasty offerings. The subs are affordably priced and generously loaded with yummy, fresh ingredients! I would definitely recommend if you are in the Marina/Cow Hollow area. But if you even so much as blink, you'll miss it!
author: Kaitlyn F.

description:
TOASTED SANDWICH HEAVEN!!!

I've been privledged to been having Viking sandwiches since I was a kid. Even before I lived in SF my family would make a special stop to grab a bite at Viking. We love it so much we even tried to recreate it at home.

Okay yes this place is nothing fancy, service is usually crap but I just love the toasted sandwiches so much that I ignore the negatives. Ive only had the veggie options but its one of my fav sandwiches EVER!!

If youre in the area def give it a try!
author: Hetal P.

description: I give them a B+ , not quite an A. Their turkey sandwich was pretty tasty but I didn't really like the cheese that they put on it,  it was kind of dry and not so tasty. The service is average nothing great nothing bad. But don't get me wrong this place is not a dump, it has its perks. Check it out for yourself. And see what you like.
author: Carmine T.

description: We had two very good toasted sandwiches.  I had the roast beef with lettuce, onions, mayo and American cheese.  My wife had turkey and Swiss with everything.  With one bag of chips we got out for under $20.  Nice man running the whole show by himself.  We got them to-go as we were staying across the street at the Comfort Inn.  They were still warm when we ate them in our room.  Give it a try!
author: David F.

description:
The avocado sandwich with provolone cheese without mayo is one of the best avocado sandwich I've had.

Food comes reasonably fast, 4 sandwich in 8 minutes

Very hearty owner

Excellent place for sandwich and recommended
author: Philip L.

description: Sandwich was amazing as always. Got the big cheese. The family that owns it is super nice. Highly recommend!!!
author: Veeral S.

description: A solid toasted sandwich shop. I got a small pastrami sandwich with a beer. I must say the bread is excellent . Now I  would say to earn a 5th star they would need to put a lot more meat in their product . If you are looking to fill your carb craving this chains isn't too bad. Reminds me of a mom and pop quizno .
author: Justin I.

description:
I just moved in a block away and am so excited to make this joint my new casual go-to.  Ten bucks for very solid toasted subs.  

Their namesake sandwich features pastrami, ham and salami, but the best part is their toasted sesame bread - the perfect amount of crunch.  Service is a little cold but adequate, same goes for the decor and seating.  Caution: there are great looking cookies tempting you at each visit so be prepared to indulge!
author: Jason X.

description: Delicious food and very cozy environment! :) make sure to get your sandwich toasted... toasted is the mosted!
author: Hailey M.

description: I tried the Avocado, Turkey and Tuna subs and they were all amazing. Still, the Avocado one was by far the best sandwich I've had in my life. The place is not fancy, but don't let that deceive you.
author: Nikolas B.

description:
Awesome fresh sandwiches, their viking sandwich is extremely tasty. A word to the wise, do tell them if you do not want mayonaise or mustard since it is going to come by default on some of their sandwiches.

Their pricing is dead on, especially if you order their foot longs which consists of two six inch sandwiches.

I was able to get 4 six inch sandwiches and two 20 oz sodas for $27.  Buying this way is well worth it.
author: Dyami C.

description: Honestly the best sub shop iv ever been to! I had it for lunch now we both are headed back there for dinner.. the guy seems really nice and the prices are fair..those subs tho
author: Cedncal M.

description: Absolutely the best pizza sandwiches in town! Ive been coming here for ten years and its never ever been a disappointment! Thank you for the best food
author: Vincent B.

description: I'm not a regular sub eater . But on the day I left SF, I had to find a place to eat near the motel I stayed at before I checked out. All restaurants within walking distant were not open untill 11am . This was the only place that open . The subs were huge and not expensive for the size . Taste really good to, unlike sub chain like Subway or Quizno . Will check back when I go to SF next time .
author: Thong D.

description: Really good subs for what they are...San Francisco subs. The bread really makes it! Being from New York, these are not the subs that are so thick you can barely take a bite out of it, but they're tasty sandwiches. I also like that you can call and place your order ahead of time. There has only been one person taking orders and making the sandwiches both times I have gone, so this will save you some time if you're in a hurry.
author: DC B.

description:
Tasty sub! ... More like tasty toast. I love a good toasted sub but the only thing good thing about it was the bread. 

I ordered the mighty Viking. There was barely any meat in this $10 sando!!!! One slice of each meat came to a total of 4 slices. So damn thin, was still hungry. #Hangry
author: JASON L.

description: Nephew and I had meatball subs. Toasted and delicious. Tiny shop that's easy to miss. I'll definitively be back next time I'm in the city. Highly recommend.
author: Nicholas C.

description:
I have been coming here every time we come to the city, nothing changes!!! The best turkey sandwich you will find anywhere.  The place doesn't look like much on the inside or the outside, but oh boy are they good sandwiches!!
Too hard to explain, you just have to try them!!
author: Julie S.

description:
Read good reviews on Yelp, went for the first time.

Got Chicken Teriyaki Sandwich. Holy christ it was gross. I have no idea what kind of meat was in that thing, but I really doubt it was chicken. And I paid $11.50 for what amounted to a toasted mystery meat log.

Man...
author: Brendan B.

description:
If you are looking for vikings in this place, you are going to find yourself as disappointed as a Minnesota Vikings fan every year. If you are looking a for a hole in the wall kind of place across the street from a BART station to grab a quick meal, this is what you are looking for.

The key is to keep your expectations low. You come here for food, expect nothing more or less and you will be satisfied. I went for the fish and chips, it wasn't anything special, but more than good enough both taste and portion wise that I wouldn't hesitate to come back here again if I am in the neighborhood.

For a mainstream suburbanite sellout like myself, these underground small mom and pop shops are one of my favorite things about SF.
author: Ian L.

description:
Prepare yourself before going in: it's pretty creepy inside and unkept. If it wasn't for the Yelp reviews I never would have stepped inside of this place. But the sub I got was actually pretty incredible, and I will return again.

Since then I've been in many times and always get a great sandwich at a decent price.

The 10 minute parking out front is handy for pick-up orders too.
author: Captain B.

description: We came across Vikings looking for a different restaurant. Glad that we did! Its a small shop with delicious food. The five of us all tried different hoagies and each were very good. The cashier/sandwhich maker (probably owner as well) was very friendly. Definitely recommend if you are in the area.
author: Gregory K.

description: We stumbled on this place while wandering the streets on San Francisco. It is a small, classic mom-and-pop sub shop that takes great care in crafting and toasting your sandwich to perfection. There are only a few tables to sit inside but it is cozy and clean. This was easily one of the best sandwiches I have had in many years and I highly recommend adding it to your lunch list when you're in the area! I am already craving to go back!
author: Beth H.

description:
Beef vs Mighty Viking
Go beef. Just tried both side by side. My brother told me the teriyaki beef was the way to go, but I wanted to try both. Definitely go for the beef over the mighty Viking, but both are delicious!! Definitely recommend this place to anyone!!
author: Jared M.

description: Good sandwich but a very weird acting asian guy working here, not friendly. Makes u feel uncomfortable in a way.
author: Çağlar A.

description:
Great things come in small packages. This place by no means is pretty, but they definitely know how to make an amazing sub! The bread they use is always toasted to perfection and everything taste super fresh. I recommend the sausage, pastrami or the turkey sub.

I give the owners a ton of credit as they are always so slammed during lunch hours, but are just so damn nice. This place kills it.
author: Nicole M.

description:
BEST SANDWICH IN SF!

We used to go here 2 to three times a week when I lived in SF.  We were in town recently and stopped in to see if the place had changed.  Sat in  a table along the wall and enjoyed a Mighty Viking with my CU-Boulder pals.  No better lunch in the City for the money.
author: Tom L.

description: Don't get the crab salad!  $15 (incl tax) but is definitely the processed fish puree ("surimi") and not crab.  Bread was definitely tasty.  Other sandwiches might be better given the bulk of good reviews.
author: Tom P.

description:
I've come in here 4 times in the last week to try out their subs during lunch.

Food:
+Chicken teriyaki- probably my favorite of the bunch. Tons of flavorful chicken. All of their subs are toasted but I don't like that they add the lettuce before toasting. It only makes it soggy. :/
+Crab Salad- WAY TOO MUCH MAYO. It dripped all over my shirt and pants. fail. the crab is there but the mayo/sauce is overpowering.
+Turkey- basic turkey sandwich

Service:
It's what appears to be a husband-wife team taking orders and making the sandwich. Not too friendly but they make their sands the way you're supposed to.

Ambience: Tiny store stuffed into Lombard Street. Only a couple of tables so I always take it to go.

-Hungry Hungry Pongy
author: Sangita A.

description:
Don't let the appearance of this place sway you, it's a great sandwich, toasted, breads great, ingredients are fresh. 

I'd recommend it to anyone.
author: Richard G.

description:
The fact that this place has 4 stars suggests 2 possibilities: A) a business owner can buy positive reviews on Yelp, or B) there's a lot of drug usage in this neighborhood severely impairing judgement. 

If you don't believe me, just walk in and look around. Ask yourself this question: is it likely to get better from here? I'm telling you it doesn't.
author: Luke K.

description:
How do you put a bunch of subpar ingredients together to make such a good sandwich, I do not know. 

These are some of the simplest sandwiches ever but the bread is the best and everything just works, don't ask why. 

These are meant Togo, the decor is not the best and the fridge is loud as hell. Just get them and head to Fort Mason to sit and eat.
author: Mark Y.

description:
If you're ever on Lombard St, you have to go to this place.

The shop is only run by one person. I was with 4 other people and the food took a while to come out, but it was well worth the wait: I had a breakfast sub (egg, ham, and cheese) and it was glorious from first bite to last. I've never tasted a breakfast sandwich/sub so good before; everything about the sandwich was just very well made. On top of that, the prices were proportionate to the size of the subs so I would say that the food is value for money.

The place, on the other hand, was a little run down - it's obviously been around for a long time. It's a little small as well, tables could sit 3 comfortable and 4 if you try hard enough, and there was only space in the shop to fit about 15 people. That shouldn't stop you from coming here though!
author: Timothy N.

description: Amazing subs!! Best counter style subs in town I think. They do Toasted to order in a small oven and makes for an epic toasty bread on outside with a mayo/Italian dressing softer inside with veggies on top and can add avacado too. I am addicted to the turkey and provolone. small shop front so it's sometimes easy to miss it.
author: Ron J.

description:
If you want a variety of toasted subs made with the care of a diligent owner, Viking is the place to go for mom 'n pop bites.  It's like Quizno's without the franchise with some specials, such as the Chicken Teriyaki sub.  They also offer salad, fruit, boiled eggs, potato salad, macaroni salad, carrot cake, chocolate cake, brownies and an assortment of cookies (chocolate chip, cranberry oatmeal raisin, peanut butter chunk) made fresh daily

The place is small enough to seat 3 - 4 tables, but most customers dine-out by picking up their orders.  I can always rely on this place for a solid sub on-the-go as long as I don't mind the prices being jacked up.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Have you ever been really excited to try a place based on Yelp reviews? Well, that was me as I walked into Vikings Giant Submarines.

PROS:
- 2 blocks from my house
- Shit, I can't think of a second

CONS:
- I wanted to take a hot shower after stepping into this place. Floor was sticky and some of the food in the display had mold growing on it.
- Man taking my order sneezed, wiped his mouth, and then grabbed the bread to make my sandwich.

I never got the opportunity to try the subs. I lost my appetite and told him to cancel my order.
author: Yum N.

description:
First review was written after 2 visits, and the subs still haven't lost it after becoming a fully-fledged addiction. I find myself craving a large turkey with avocado at least once a week.

Word of caution, the subs are toasted to perfection and addiction is almost a certainty. I'd start a 10 step program if I had the willpower.
author: Brian K.

description:
Small little mom and pops sandwich place. The menu is not incredibly exciting but it has your basics - turkey, pastrami, ham, roast beef and all the normal fixings and salads.

But they grilled the sandwiches so my sammie was hot and pressed and the bread crunched in your mouth as the cheese oozed inside. Yummers!
author: Nicha K.

description:
I live nearby and I frequent Viking's.   The sandwiches are solid (SF style toasted subs).  The one key for me is to request that they toast the subs BEFORE putting the vegetables on.  I hate warm vegetables on sandwiches, which is their default methodology.

I will put it this way: it is not among my favorite sandwich places, but it is good and convenient.
author: Tony B.

description: The sub shop is very small.  It had about 4 tables which seated snuggly. One person was working there and she had to do everything herself.  She was friendly and was very cooperative about allowing us to add onions or changing out condiments.  We went there because most yelpers rated it a 4 or  5.   It did not meet those expectations for me.  I ordered the teriyaki chicken sub. It was on delicious French bread but by the time I dug into my sandwich the bread was soaked and soggy.  I won't go back. It just wasn't my taste
author: Sherian V.

description:
[M]ona: 4 Stars
[W]ayne 4 Stars
Average: 4 Stars

+ Fresh
+ Fast / Made to Order
+ Accepts Credit Cards

- No Parking
- Pricey

[W] Vikings Giant Subs on Lombard and Van Ness is a small little mom and pops sandwich shop. It's been since FOREVER. I remember coming here when I was still back in middle and high school. It used to be a big spot to eat at for everyone who went to Galileo High School but then again, it's been about or almost over a decade since back then! Anyways, this is my absolute FAVORITE place to get a CRAB SALAD SANDWICH! No other places that makes sandwiches makes it as good as Vikings. They have another Vikings over on Ocean St near City College but that doesn't even COMPARE to Vikings on Lombard.
 
If you guys like subs as much as I do, this is THE PLACE TO BE! The only thing that sucks about this place is that there is no parking AT ALL. There's a little 1 car spot in front of the shop but it's only for like 10-15 minutes of parking. Definitely not enough for you to eat there. Everything here is made fresh to order and their bread is toasted hot for you to eat. This time me and Mona had their homemade macaroni salad, pastrami sandwich, and their ever popular crab salad sandwich. 
 
Honestly I thought the macaroni salad http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/bgoSfVaZFXDthHLbWxyeQw?select=2SBehLqyyYnz7-Y-Qy0eBg was a little on the tangy/sour side. Mona had the hot pastrami sandwich http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/bgoSfVaZFXDthHLbWxyeQw?select=qXX1QabUAmZO9bQfoDsGuA which I have to say was pretty damn good as well. Normally the pastrami elsewhere is a little on the dry side but this one was quite juicy. As for mine, the crab salad sandwich http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/bgoSfVaZFXDthHLbWxyeQw?select=IpU2eX-mEIa-tEoZvE-9dA, that one is ALWAYS a favorite. It was so good, I had to have a large sub for myself haha. There's really no service here because the store is so small (3-4 small tables) so everything is self serve unless you consider them bring the food to your table service heh.

[M] The subs were delicious theres no denying that, but they were a little on the pricer side. Sizes comes in Small (around $6.95) and a Large (around $9.95) size. So it is definitely worth it to upgrade your sandwich to a large for $3 more. 
 
[W] If you don't mind picking up or live around the area, try them out! If you like crab salad, don't miss out on their sandwich and if you love pastrami don't miss out on that neither! As for the macaroni salad.......yea.....haha.
author: Mona C.

description:
A true hole in the wall treasure. Can't put my finger on exactly what makes this sandwich so good, It might be the heated Columbo bread, or the mayo spread they use. Most sandwiches come exactly the same way, Toasted bread, shredded lettuce, type of cheese, meat depending on sandwich, mayo and that's it. They the sandwich in the oven and voila! Pretty basic ingredients, but one of my favorite sandwiches, if not my favorite. The avocado is my favorite, but most people go for one teri chicken or beef, or the meatball. 

Save yourself time and order the bigger one.
author: Mark S.

description: These subs are the biznass. Better than all major chains, probably not quite as good as Ike's or Mr. Pickles. Meatball is my jam.
author: C N M.

description:
beef teriyaki is great, have gotten off/on the last 6yrs.  its groundhog day for me here, i walk by and say hmm should i? 

walk in order the small, bag of lays, the ones that r bad for ya (classic) and a pepsi.  always say to myself man its kinda pricey.  bite into it and say man that's a good sandwich!

the guy is a grinder, just nods and grunts instead of hello and how are ya & i love that. kinda like my mook buddies on sunday afternoons.  

you'll never see him write the words 'ashley' or 'courtney' accompanied by smiley faces on the wrapper.  i don't think if he even asks for 'dine in' or 'take out' as its a crap shoot of tray or brown bag for ya

watch that first bite...it's a doozie
author: Clark G.

description: A hole in the wall with an absolute great sandwich.  Had the turkey and it was one of the best sandwiches I've ever had! !...a must if you are in the area..!!  I was just visiting
author: Erik S.

description: I gave them one star last time but this place turned around: got a large teryaki sanchwich on a soft roll with Avocado ($14). Expensive but delicious and fresh.  Also got a brownie (low expectation, figured it would be a wewk old but it was fresh and moist).  Shows you need to give 2nd chances once in a while...
author: josh d.

description:
Best sandwich I've ever had.   (BBQ Beef)

The place doesn't really look like much on the outside (and they don't put much effort on the inside either), but man, did I leave a satisfied customer.  

I had read the Yelp reviews before going, so my expectations were pretty high, and I gotta admit: I was skeptical as I watched him prepare my sandwich.   Everything just looked so...ordinary.  I thought I'd been duped and was getting something comparable to a Blimpie sub (yes, that's a knock on Blimpie.  Seriously Blimpie, how do you exist?!)

But once the sandwich came together and was toasted just right, it was amazing.  The bread was crispy (without being hard) and flaky without falling apart.  The meat was tender and delicious, and the sauce was the perfect kind of BBQ; balancing sweet and tangy.

I only wish I had ordered a bigger sandwich.  :-(
author: Matt D.

description: I ordered the salami/pastrami/ham whole sub with provolone, mayo, lettuce, onions and tomato. The sub was toasted to perfection and it tasted great. Not much seating, and depending when you go, it might take a while to order and get your sub. Well worth the wait.
author: Michio A.

description:
Great sandwich but halfway through eating they took the paper bag they had given me the sandwich in off the table and put it back in the stack of bags to be used again...

I want my bag back
author: Reid H.

description: The bread makes the sub!!!  Fresh ingredients loaded up on the subs.  My favorite is the teriyaki beef.   This is not a place you want to sit and eat at, it is a togo order type establishment.  Also one thing to note is to take cash, if you use a credit card there is a $10 minimum.
author: Bud F.

description:
Dear Viking,

Your subs are not Giant, you are overpriced, please slice your tomatoes thicker, add more meat and cheese, please give me a choice of bread, and please stop burning my sub!

Ive been there dozens of times just hoping to be happy with my lunch and I am always disappointed.
author: Russ B.

description: Great bread and fresh ingredients. The meats he uses are tasty but only 1 think layer of meat for a 10 sando...good if you're hungry at Black Magic but not the best.
author: Andy A.

description: Really good sandwich place.  My friend recommended this place for lunch and we ordered a large teriyaki beef sandwich split between me and 1 other person.  The beef, sauce, everything was good.  It was a bit messy to eat but can't really complain.  The owners were super nice.  We ordered and then they told us that we can pay later.  Awesome service!
author: Joyce L.

description: A small sandwich joint near Van Ness that sufices for quick, no-frills meal.  The cheese sandwich is their version of a veggie.  Overall it was a solid sub: plenty of cheese, the usual veggies, an option to have it toasted.  Basically, this place is tantamount to a Subway, but at a premium.  That small sandwich (6 inches or so), set me back about $6.  Add in the fact that there is a $10 credit card minimum and I left with a sour a taste in my mouth.
author: Kavi D.

description: Had a small pastrami with everything, macaroni salad and coke for about $13. The sandwich was toasted. It was good. I'd come back and eat here again.
author: Preston B.

description: Mighty good sub. Pretty much the perfect ratio of bread to meat and the bread was fresh and soft. Gotta come back for some of the other menu items, but the mighty viking doesn't disappoint (Definitely get the large as you can always finish the rest later, which is exactly what I did)...
author: Nicolas H.

description:
Stopped in here on our way to the Golden Gate Bridge with my brother and our friend.

We all ordered the meatball sub and drinks, which came to more than $30 - kinda steep for a sandwich shop.

My brother looked at the menu and it said that cheese cost extra so he assumed that there wouldn't be any on the sandwich (he can't eat cheese). After placing the order and sitting down, he thought better of it and went back up to double check. The woman behind the counter had already made his sandwich with tons of cheese melted all over it.

It was an innocent mistake on my brother's part, he should have asked to begin with, but the worst part was that the woman refused to make him a new sandwich and was going to make him buy a new one! I'm sorry, but I come from the ideology that the customer is always right, especially after paying so much for the first one!

It took quite a bit of haggling, but I finally stared her down and she made him a new one, after complaining to us that it was our mistake and what was she going to do with this already made sandwich? It definitely made me feel uncomfortable being lectured by the woman over such a simple mistake.

The sandwiches tasted okay, but nothing to write home about and way too expensive for what you get. And, obviously, I think the customer service is abysmal.
author: Casey S.

description: Great sandwich spot with toasted  rolls. Get the mighty Viking.
author: Pete R.

description: This place truly takes 'don't judge a book by its cover' to the max. The place itself is slightly cramped and gross, but the sandwiches are amazing! Ask how big the bread is first though (the large is a better deal). The lady who makes the sandwiches toasts them to perfection, with stringy, gooey, melted cheese. She takes longer to ring you up than to make the sandwich itself. Don't let the place fool you, this place is the bomb-diggidy!
author: Yael L.

description:
I would give it a 3.5 if there were 1/2 stars. 

The sandwich itself was a 4, but the price was a 3. 

I ordered a pastrami sandwich which was tasty and well made. The bread was fresh and not soggy a-la-subway. 

I also ordered a turkey sub and was told that it was very good. 

As far as portions are concerned it was on the small side considering it was $6.50 for a small. Keep in mind that $5 at subway gets you a foot long sub. 

The quality was a million times better than subway. Didn't want anyone to be confused about that.
author: Carlos A.

description:
Ok, these subs are NOT giant.  Also, I think they only have one kind of bread; a french roll.

BUT their sandwiches are quite good, if not extremely expensive.  A large teriyaki chicken sub is $10.  The interior is a little outdated (plants literally EVERYWHERE) but luckily we always order to go.

I wish I could eat here more but for the price and the fact that there's no parking really makes it difficult.  Oh well.  Get the teriyaki sub if you get the chance!
author: Kimiko Q.

description: Best sandwich that I have ever had. To illustrate how much I like it, I have eaten there a good 500 times over the last 15+ years. Don't expect a great atmosphere. Don't expect a gourmet sandwich. What you should expect is a delicious, grubby sandwich that is very addicting. The owners are usually the ones cooking, and they have been very nice to me over the years. Chicken Teriyaki sub is my favorite of the bunch.
author: Baron Von B.

description:
I've only bought ONE sandwich here, and I've never gone back.  The Teriyaki Beef is all you need to know.  Unless you don't eat meat, in which case the Avocado with all the veggies will be right up your alley.  But I don't think it would be good toasted.

All sandwiches are toasted in an oven to melt the cheese, heat the meat and slightly wilt the veggies.  There are a few tables and a small counter to sit at.

OK ... I have tried the Mighty Viking and a bite of the Ham and Swiss ... it's something about the dressing that does it.

Go here and order anything and you'll be happy.  The only knock is they don't have french fries like the Ocean Avenue location.

Cash only.
author: Michael M.

description:
LOVE. First place to grab a quick bite after coming to SF. The service was friendly and quick. We dinned in the small shop, even though there was only enough seating for about 4 small groups.

 I ordered the italian sandwich which was juicy and saucy to a perfection. They put attention to detail in that sub-- it was toasted lightly to compliment the drippy dressing. 

I also asked to use the restroom, lets just say.. it's the exact image of what people would think in a small tiny cramped place. The bathroom was a single stall used primarily for employees, with a sink that has been used since the 70's. The lights even went out on me while I was in there.
author: Wendy L.

description:
Great toasted subs!!!!! 

The place is a tiny holy in the wall, so we get a couple subs to go. Then walk over to Fort Mason and have a picnic overlooking the bridge. What could be better?
author: Cary Elizabeth L.

description:
Ahhh, my former favorite "hit the spot" sandwich place. Don't get me wrong, I've been coming here since I was a kid but things haven't the same between us since I found little lucca's ( I then proceeded to cheat on her with Ike's). So somehow, this became my THIRD favorite sandwich place.

I don't know why this place is so good. Is it because of that one hundred year old mini oven that almost burns the bread, or is it all the cheese that melts to creamy gooey perfection, or is it that creamy house mayo sauce dressing topping?? It could also be the fresh avocados they prep every morning with the slightly crispy lettuce that compliments the cheese and crispy bread.

I will tell you one thing though, once you walk through that door and the smell finally hits your sensory receptors, your stomach is going to whimper like a hungry dog begging for food and all you will be able to think of is "How much LONGER??????"
author: Alex C.

description:
I go to to the in glen park ALL the time since I was young and this time I was in the marina area so I went here and it was horrible. Its more expensive and much lower quality of meat. Not worth it here at all. The First Cup Deli down the block on van ness is MUCH better. 

If you want vikings go to the one in glen park! and they have Mitchell's ice cream :)
author: Monica L.

description:
The exterior of this place did not make this place appealing to eat at at all. I was having a morning jog and had promised the roommates I'd pick up some sandwiches for lunch. I didn't have a lot of cash on me and couldn't find a nearby Subway. My stomach was killing me so I decided to take a chance and try this place. It was a simple sandwich menu, with a lot of beverages, and snacks to tack on. I ordered a large Vikings sub and a small crab salad sandwich. They turned out to be very LARGE and pretty GOOD. 

Though the Vikings sub was a bit on the super meaty and salty side. A LOT of people (at least 7) came by to pick up their Avocado sandwich orders.

It's no Ike's, but I'd come back!

:D
author: Kathy H.

description:
More evidence to support my "if you ask nicely you are more than likely to receive" theory. Viking's didn't exactly strike me as an egg white friendly place considering most sandwiches are a celebration of all things not so healthy. But I asked anyway, with a smile, and the very nice lady had no problem doing it for me. Complimenting my choice didn't hurt either.

The egg whites, turkey and tomato finished product was good if a little on the expensive side. But since I got my egg whites, Viking's is getting a fourth star.
author: Jason B.

description:
One of the best beef teriyaki sandwiches I have ever had.  The bun is toasty with melted cheese and ample pile of beef teriyaki.  The large is very filling and it hits the spot.

Order to go because the decor is highly suspect.  The place use to have a television, not sure what happened.  And the bathroom is interesting; located through a metal gate and in an alley.
author: R W.

description: I used to live a couple blocks away from Viking's and OH MY GOSH I miss them!  When I was in town a couple weeks ago, I made a special point of driving into the city just to go here.  They put some sort of sauce on their sandwiches that is just amazing.  If you need a sandwich fix, this is absolutely the place to go!
author: Jane D.

description: I have eaten at all three Vikings Giant Submarine places in San Francisco and as far as I know they are not related to one another. The original place on Lombard street is owned by a Korean couple who make great submarine sandwiches. They have a small place with a small, old oven but the sandwiches are awesome. The Beef teriyaki is excellent but their best sandwich is the Turkey Avocado which is delicious. This is amongst the best Sandwich places in San Francisco. You will not go wrong eating here. The other Vikings sub places on Ocean Avenue and the one in Glenn Park also offer excellent sandwiches but not nearly as good as the original on Lombard Street.
author: Anthony L.

description: Diamond in the rough!  I got the pastrami/salami/ham sub and it was delicious.  Great bread, good size sandwich.  Got a nice crunch to it.  Looking forward to trying some of their other subs, particularly the beef teriyaki and meatball.
author: Jonathan S.

description: The meatball sub was delicious! Neighborhood hidden gem on Van Ness. Owned by a nice Korean man. They also sell subs by the half. Amazing!
author: Jeanne C.

description:
I'll admit, I'm biased towards this place because the lady behind the counter is Korean, and I spent a lot of time in Korea, so we hit it off and always chat when I'm in there. It immediately makes me like the place more.

That being said... the food is really good. The viking sub is what I get every time, because it is huge, filling, full of meat, and made perfectly. They toast it really well, and load it up with all the fixins'. It never falls apart like a subway sub, and is always really tasty.

They also have Korean beer there. Only Hite, not Cass... but still, better than none. I like that it's a bit of a hole in the wall - but they're always friendly, and my fiance and I have always been really pleased with the food.
author: Nick B.

description:
Not sure what experience all of these 5-star people had here, but this was just a crappy sandwich place.

Very limited choices (zero choice of bread in fact), high prices, unfriendly service and a cramped location. The sandwich wasn't even very good.

Go elsewhere.
author: Kevin M.

description:
I've been here a few times now and tried a few different sandwiches, but remain unimpressed. 

Yes, the bread is toasted well and has a soft middle and crispy exterior, but the sandwiches are just lacking whatever it is that makes an ordinary sandwich something really special. Maybe I just haven't ordered the right sandwich yet.
author: Emily C.

description:
This is my first ever Yelp review but I felt compelled to write something.  There are so many places to get good sandwiches in the area and Viking's Submarines is not one of them.  The reviews on Yelp were great so I was very excited to try a sandwich at a "4 star" place, but as an avid sandwich lover I was very disappointed with the fact that they only had one type of bread, put very little meat on the sandwich, had no special sauce or even dijon mustard, no cheddar or pepperjack cheese (no cheddar, really????), and only had one person working there at noon on a Sunday to take orders and make sandwiches.  

Overall it was a very disappointing experience but if you are a big fan of very very plain things then this place is for you, as long as you don't want any other bread but a white roll.
author: Pat M.

description:
While I do love the sandwiches, the overall experience can be quite unpleasant. There is usually only one person working which is fine when its quiet, but upsetting during the lunch hour... especially on Saturdays. 
Favorite sandwich: Chicken Teriyaki
author: Emily C.

description:
I "USED" to love this place when I was younger. l I drove by yesterday and decided to to stop by. Well it's not quite as good as what I remember. Luckily, I didn't have to wait very long. I ordered a large pastrami sub which was $10. Barely any meat and no choice of bread. The bread was a bit burnt for my taste. The pastrami tasted like Oscar Mayer. 

Maybe the fact that I've been all over this country now and have tried almost every "known" sandwich, this sub shop is no longer on my goto list. I should have learned not to order a pastrami sandwich outside of NYC.
author: Rocky S.

description: This is the typical hole in the wall place that only locals know about it. Order a Korean Teriyaki sub, you won't believe how good it tastes!
author: Eduardo S.

description:
Delicious sandwiches!  They're very fast at making sandwiches.  Most come in large and small sizes.  Small usually fills me up, but I can see guys may want to get the large.

The place is small, and usually people get their orders to go.  Although, they do have a TV in there for those that are dining in.

I've never been disappointed with anything that I've ordered!  They're toasted and tasty!  

My Favorite: Hot Sausage Sandwich!
author: Kristina P.

description: Had the teriyaki beef and a macaroni salad. I threw the salad away after two bites because it tasted rotten. The teriyaki beef sandwich was okay. It was served on a sourdough roll with melted American cheese and some type of mayonnaise. Probably won't go back.
author: Josh F.

description:
Viking's a quite literally a hole in the wall place, that you could easily walk right past and not notice if you blinked. I'm a fan of sandwiches, so I search out sandwich spots, and in my opinion it has some of the tastiest sandwiches in area.

My usually is the meatball, which I order spicy. You get a choice of tabasco spicy or jalapeno spicy. Jalapeno burns more. But both are good.

The turkey avacado is also quite good. I've tried the pastrami once, and it was just ok. A large burly man recently recommended I try the Viking sandwich, which seems to be made from a collection of meats. So that's next on my list.

The prices are a bit high. A large sandwich ends up costing me around $9, while you could go to subway for a $5 footlong. And there is no choice of bread, as someone already mentioned on an earlier review. But who cares. If it's a good sandwich, which it usually it, just eat it. If you wanna save money, you could make sandwiches at home. But this guy seems to have stayed in business for quite some time, in a relatively competitive area, so he's doing something right. 

Bottom line, good sandwich.
author: Arash M.

description: We wound up getting lost on our way to Miller's East Coast Deli and somehow drove by this little gem.  We were so hungry that we decided to munch on a quick beef terayaki sandwich on our way to go eat lunch.  Actually it was my decision, but my wonderful fiance was supportive and she let me order "just one large beef teriyaki".  From the outside, this place looks like it went out of business.  Inside is quite clean and cozy.  We love our teriyaki sandos, and this place did not disappoint us at all.  High up on the list of great OG SF sandwich spots.  We like the bread at King Foot a bit better, but the steak here seems to be MSG free!  I am addicted to that beef teriyaki sando.  This place is great, the prices are right, and we are glad that we stopped here on our way our to lunch.  The review for our lunch will be the next thing we write about.  Yep...
author: D.c.g G.

description: This place is amazing!   True it's not a place that you would want to spend a lot of time, but the sandwiches are fantastic!  Get the BBQ beef on wheat bread!  YUM
author: James D.

description:
Let me start off by saying that I love sandwiches. LOVE them. And I have a particular affinity for sub sandwiches. But this place is an affront to sub sandwiches and lovers of said sandwiches. I was so disappointed that it compelled me to write my very first Yelp review. 

I went in on a Saturday for lunch and ordered a 6" meatball sub for $6.99. The lady behind the counter basically took out 1 huge meatball from the tray, cut it in half and kind of spread the two halves across the bread leaving lots of empty, lonely bread on both ends,  threw some provolone on it and stuck it in the toaster oven briefly. Upon retrieving it from the oven, she immdiately started to wrap it up. Whoa, whoa, whoa! No offer for shredded lettuce, tomato, onion or even peperoncinis??? You've got a whole tray of that stuff ready to go! So when I asked her if she could just put on some lettuce, tomato and a little dressing, she looked at me as if she had never in all her time behind a deli counter heard of such a thing. Reluctantly, she haphazardly threw some of the requested items in. All this build up to bite into a bland sandwich with 2 giant meatball halves still half cold from the refrigerator. 

I honestly don't know how this place has received any more than 2 stars from reviewers.Now maybe it was just a bad day? Maybe it was the weekend coverage and the lady just didn't give a crap? I'll never know because I'll probably never be back there again.
author: Sebastian L.

description:
I guess you could say that I am pretty biased because I have grown up with these viking submarines since my mom would always bring them home on her way from work...but I think they are the ultimate subs in the whole city
When I was smaller I would LOVE the bbq chicken or teriyaki chicken...but now i tend to get roast beef or turkey with avocado...all are AMAZING
they have this special sauce dripping through it that no other place can possibly master...delish!
Even though some people think its pricey---it is definitely worth it!
author: Jane K.

description:
I used to come here during my Freshman year at Galileo High School.

This place would be PACKED. 

After moving to another part of the city at the end of the year, I haven't been back since. 

Until sometime last year. Everything is still the same as it was 15 years ago. Damn! Has it really been that long?!?!


You do have to wait a bit as they make your sandwich. If you're in a hurry, call in your order.

This is THE original sub shop. This beats Subway and Quizno's any day.

Sandwiches are on the small side so I recommend getting the large sandwich.
Solid sandwich, but a bit over priced for the basic options.  I'll go back though, as its right down the street from my house.
author: Ian L.

description:
I seriously can not remember when last time I finished the entire sandwich was, I mean, entire, nothing left, even at Tartine my favorite place I always left some bread on my plate.

Teriyaki chicken sandwich was succulent, savory, spicy, juicy, creamy, cheesy, crunchy, warm and drippy...OMG...

Thanks to my friend Jack, who knows the owner for 10 years, we got extra meat and awesome sandwiches. I've lived in the neighborhood, and I still hang around there a lot, but I would never step into the hole in the wall. Thanks Jack!
author: Yuchi C.

description:
The hidden gem on the menu board here is the teriyaki chicken sub. I wouldn't even think of ordering anything else here, it's that good.

Their default is always to burn the bread slightly on the top, I always request that they heavily brown it at the top instead. It's pretty hard to do it that way so the bread stays super crispy AND keep the cheese perfectly melted over the runny mayo lettuce and perfectly seasoned chicken and but that is their secret I guess.

Also if I have a choice I like to come on weekdays versus weekends because there is almost a 1 star bump quality in difference between the people who make them on those days.

Make use of the green customer parking space in front if it's available since parking around the marina can be somewhat of a nightmare during rush hour traffic.

The bathroom is a bit dingy, but it's not really meant for customer use.
author: Mark Y.

description: This is our fav local sub shop. The bread is crusty and soft at the same time. They could use higher quality deli meats but eh it is what it is. I love their mac salad and they have mango snapple which is the cure all for hangovers.
author: J F.

description: Found this place near my house and was surprised how good it was! Cute little local business with one guy working. It has indoor seating but I ordered mine to go. The meatball sub was good and the tuna melt was delish. Great little place I'll be visiting again soon. Their brownies were also great!
author: Marie F.

description:
This place brings back so many memories...

I have been eating their subs since I was like 10. I can't believe they have been around for this long, but then again they have the yummiest sandwiches ever. I like to grab one and then walk down to fisherman's Worf and just sit in the grass and eat.
author: Raquel G.

description:
YUMMY!  

Yes it is a bit pricey but it is a small hole in the wall. Would choose to go here over subway any day!
author: Angel K.

description:
Subs so good they'll make you break your no-carbs-whatsoever rule. Subs so big they'll make you wish you hadn't. 

It's something about that oil and vinegar...mmm.
author: Autumn K.

description:
teriyaki Beef...AMAZING! All of their sandwiches are good though.
BTW - I saw a review that said cash only. Not true, they accept debit or credit.
author: Chris W.

description: Truly fantastic subs toasted just right. They are priced about right also. I stayed at the hotel across the street and Viking Subs was the only thing I really liked about it.
author: Mike O.

description:
Decent subs, but kind of expensive.  $12 for a "large" (Giant? I had no trouble finishing one) sub and a coke?  Yikes.  

I like that they but a lot of meat on their subs and they toast them all for you.  Unfortunately, they put all the lettuce and veggies on it before they stick it in the oven, so the veggies tend to get a little wilted.  

That's not to say that I don't enjoy their subs, but I wouldn't go out of my way to hit this spot.
author: matt c.

description:
The Best Subs in San Francisco (and possibly the World!)

I had my first Viking's Sub back in 2010 whilst I was on holiday in San Francisco, for the past 2 years I've been craving a Viking's Sub and nothing at Subway could even come close to how good the subs in Viking's are. 

Fast-forward 2 years later and the subs are just as good as I remembered! I was in San Francisco 4 nights and I ate at Viking's 3 of these! At first it does look pricey at around $9 for a large sub but the large subs are big enough for 2. 

There is also a range of delicious cookies available - Peanut Butter Crunch, Chocolate Chip and Cranberry Oatmeal, the cookies are baked to perfection with a lovely soft centre and a crispy outside. 

Looks can be deceiving, from the outside Viking's Subs doesn't look like anything special but once you've had one sub you'll never look back.
author: Louise F.

description: Good Sandwich, very overpriced. We ordered 4 subs, three avocado veggies & one cheese. Out of 4, 1 of them was over burned., We had to scrape it & then eat it. Not great at that price.
author: Dylan L.

description:
These subs scream "Eat me!!"  They invented the toasted sub here... all others are just imitators.  

Side note: If you park out front of the place on Lombard (the street looks close to flat), make sure you curb your wheels.  I got nailed with a ticket once... very, very lame... thanks SF DPT  *!?#^&@#*
author: Dave L.

description:
Yesssss, toasted turkey avo, right on the way back to marin.  Thinkin bout shortin em a star for puttin less meat in the wiches than back in the day.  Still good to me, I think Im the only one who likes an even amount of shtuff in my sandwich.  I hate it when you bite into it and theres an inch of meat, theres gotta be a good ratio.  Most people I know would complain about the amount of meat.  A salami sandwich made at my house has only six slices homie.   Actually Five stars, I forgot theyre korean.   
Represent yellow,   REPRESENT.
author: Hen A.

description: I feel myself constantly craving their beef terriyaki sandwich for the past few days and finally had one yesterday- it was so freakin good. I want more!!!
author: M W.

description:
The mighty Viking is great!  Toasted is better.  All their sandwiches are really good (especially the Mighty Viking).  The potato salad is great also.  For some reason their hard boiled eggs are tough to de-shell... humm?

Update- It's not the powerhouse it used to be.  Last 3-4 sandos just aren't blowing the hair back like they used to.
author: Tyler C.

description:
While I love Viking,  I must place a caveat on this review.....when the guy (owner) is working there,  this place is top notch.  He keeps track of all the orders and fills them efficiently.   There is a woman who sometimes works there who can't speak english and has messed up my last two orders.  

That being said.....TASTY toasted sandwiches which are a bit pricy......but to me,  they are worth it.  I always add the jalapenos to give my sandwich a bit of an extra kick.
author: Pete D.

description:
I'm not in the area much, but when I'm there, and there's parking available, I try and stop by Viking Sandwiches on Lombard.

The Toasted Subs they make are the BEST! And they're HUGE. I always stick to the Mighty Viking with everything. They are great sandwiches if you're going straight out to have a picnic too... 

this place is my vote for the best Toasted Subs in the city!
author: Kenny W.

description:
Well went here based on Yelp ratings but left disappointed.  Not sure but I've had lots of really good subs and even though I got their signature Mighty Viking I wasn't impressed.

The sub itself might be long but not that wide and the ingredients tasted a bit stale.  It was dinner so maybe things are fresher at lunch but that's no excuse.  Oh well...
author: Gene X.

description:
My heart's racing as I stare at the toasty foot-long before me.  My muscles tense in anticipation while I try to figure out how I'll possibly fit the whole thing in my mouth.  It's not my first time, but every encounter with this big boy makes my toes tingle.

I manage to cram it in my mouth and my tongue is hit with the hot, gooey goodness that oozes out of a Viking's Giant.  The sauce dribbles down my chin and my eyes involuntarily roll upwards--almost as if thanking God himself for my mouthgasm.

Every Viking's sub is a heavenly, oxytocin-inducing experience.  I'm hooked--a genuine Viking's harlot--and I have no shame.  You don't need to be making the passage to Marin to join the VIking's harem, its worth coming to simply to bask in the indulgence of the sandwiches themselves.
author: Kat P.

description:
How can you not give Viking's 5 stars? Great prices, great sandwiches, same old friendly guy, great fries and milkshakes. 
Personally love getting either the Chicken Philly or the Regular Philly with extra mushrooms....ugh...my stomach is mad right now for talking about Viking's and having any today.....
author: Paulo L.

description:
I used to love this place until last experience.

2 regular sando's cost $17.80 , with 1 canned drink. Never going there again. Absurd to pay that much for a toasted sandwich.
author: Christopher H.

description:
Mighty Viking = $12

While in portion size, I'd say this wouldn't feed a hungry, Mighty Viking, but it still tastes damn good.

Didn't hurt that the only clientele inside was Jason Lee, hangin inside with his prego chick.  Was thinking I'd drop some Karmaloop knowledge but no one wants to be that guy, 'specially not yours truly.
author: Oscar J.

description:
Viking Submarines toasts sandwiches to perfection. This means it is gently crunchy on the outside and pillowy soft on the inside. Don't forget to  grab plenty of napkins! Subs here are definitely mouthwateringly drippy!

My faves: 
1. Bulgogi Sandwich like you've never had before. It's called "Teriyaki Beef." Wonderfully toasted w/juicy marinated thinly sliced beef, cheese, and some mayo, this is an extremely satisfying lunch!! 
2. Turkey avocado. If you like turkey avocado sandwiches, definitely try it at Viking - toasted!

Seating: There are just a few seats in the place. 
Parking: The 2 10-minute parking spots on the curb are so convenient!
author: Sharon C.

description:
The Single Teriyaki Chicken Sandwich is one of my all time favorites.  The sandwich is toasted.  A crusty bread encapsulates the flavorful chicken, melted cheese and crunchy lettuce.  I add tobasco for a kick, which makes it the perfect lunch.

I remember cutting school to eat here (ok, it wasn't that much of an adventure since I went to school just down the street), however my friends and I would eat Viking's toasted subs while watching Jerry Springer during 4th period.  Good times.
author: Chanelle W.

description:
I am really torn over whether to give this three stars or four stars. Walking home with my BBQ beef sub, I was definitely thinking three stars. What's this, a highly-rated sub place on yelp and they don't have a grill? So I can't get a cheese steak and I can't get a cheeseburger sub?

I was going to get the roast beef sub. But when I eat roast beef, I want it to be slathered with horseradish. No horseradish here. So as you saw, I ordered the BBQ beef sub. A bit expensive; $6 for a 6" and about $10 for 11" (11"? Why not go all the way and do 12"?)

I was almost disappointed that the sub was so delicious! I was really looking forward to being different and giving this place three stars. But OMFG. So good. The BBQ sauce was excellent.

I probably won't go back too often because this isn't the type of place I think of when I am in the mood for a sub. But I am sure one day the thought of that excellent BBQ beef sub will hit me, and I'll just have to run down here and get one. And I might even put down the $10 for a large one if I am feeling especially peckish.
author: Stu M.

description:
DAAAAAAMMMMMMMMMMNNNNNNNNNN!!!

I bought the Italian sub, this sub is no joke. Wow. It's so good, toasty, warm, bursting with flavor!

I dropped by just for something small to eat and this place really hit the spot. It's a hole in the wall mom and pop shop. That's all you need to know because the subs really deliver.

I'm not about to bitch about the price since it's SF and the sandwiches speaks for itself.
author: Hue M.

description:
I find myself craving Viking's pastrami sub quiet often. They are sooo good. MmmMmm. It's toasted just right and is full of delight. 

One problem. They have raised their prices and it's now like $10 for a large. Still worth it, although I wont be having Viking's all the time now.
author: Jeanette P.

description:
there are probably 100 sandwich shops between my house and Viking Sub, and I don't care..this place makes a yummy toasted turkey sub (add an advocado and extra sauce please).

Props to Tom for Viking.
author: Jason N.

description:
Ok I was very excited to try this place given it's 2 blocks from my apt, but after 2 earnest attempts, I have to say I'm disappointed. 

I tried the turkey/avocado the first time, and it was OK. The second time, I tried the "legendary" Might Viking, again just OK. The lady made the first one, and the guy made the second so I don't think that's the issue. 

My one-liner: decent sando with good bread for too much money. It's around $10-13 depending on toppings etc., and blasphemous as it may be, I prefer Subway with their wider array of veggies (read: jalapenos!) whether they're $5 or not. 

I'm sorry, I really wanted to like it :(
author: ben c.

description: Great place to enjoy a quick bite to eat!
author: Tony P.

description: Easily the best submarine sandwich in the Bay Area. Don't miss the teriyaki beef!
author: Ed L.

description: I visited San Francisco a year ago and stayed at one of the local hotels there on the block where the resturant is located.This place caught my eye when i seen it but i hesitated to try it but I am glad I did.This is one of the best sandwich shops I have been to in awhile. I am from Chicago and have not have a sub that taste that great.The meats and cheese were great but the bread played a main factor to it all. When in San Francisco again. I will  make this my first stop.
author: Scott H.

description: My friend just brought me a sub from this joint..and OMG it was declicious!!!! I thght Marina Subs was good..but it pales in comparison to Viking's...I swallowed my Turkey Avocado sub in less than 2 minutes..The bread was slightly toasty and there was just the right amount of fixings....YUMMmmmmmyyyyyy
author: Mimi T.

description:
Portions suck. 

pretty good and fresh veggies, but i shi* for 4 hours...

f this place
author: angelo b.

description:
One of the best sandwiches around. I should know; I grew up around here, and for many years have had the nickname "Sandwich."

Anyway, this place is great, but not sure the grilling is enough to justify the hefty 8.29 price tag.
