Still, the effect created by warming salami, cheese and mayo on bread is sublime. 

As a semi-Muslim this is one of the few forays into pork that doesn't make me feel guilty in the least.
author: Jason R.

description:
I've been here a few times now, and found it seems to vary.

First time - bam! parking right in front (yay for 15min parking spaces that are actually useful).  Great pastrami sandwich - bread toasted just right - crispy outside, soft moist inside, great meat:bread:other ratio.   This place is awesome!   Sure, some places pile on tons of meat, which is kinda neat, but it changes the taste of the sandwich to a pile of meat, with a bit of bread and 'fixins.  

Other times I've gone, parking is hit or miss.  The viking sub (or whatever it's called - the combo with salami and two other meats) was sort of meh, in my opinion.  The salami flavor overwhelms the other meats.  The teriyaki beef, while decent, seems to be missing something.  As is, I think I'll stick with the pastrami.
author: T C.

description:
This is one of those places that you judge before you try it.  Or at least that's what I did.  But damn, I'm glad that I was hella hung over today and couldn't bare the thought of walking very far to get something to eat--which is why I "resorted" to getting a sandwich here.

I tried the beek teriyake--so yummy.  They'll melt cheese on any of 'em if you want, but even in my most hungover state, this lactard must say "no."  I next tried the meatball sub.  Yeah, I needed/ate 2 subs in one sitting, what of it?!  I was hungover, remember?  And they were both really, really good.  I contemplated getting a BLT, but fat kid had to stop after the second one!

This cute couple runs the little whole-in-the-wall sub shop and they toast up all of their sammys in an oven, which may not be novel for a sub but certainly worth noting.  They also sell a variety of accoutrements--chips, deviled eggs (!!), potato salad, green salad and homemade carrot cake with cream cheese frosting (I found it so weird that they sell that as well, but, hey, carrot cake rocks) to name a few.  They sell beer, too.

It's kinda like your one-stop-shop for a kick-ass picnic at Fort Mason or along Crissy Field.
author: Justine H.

description:
Want a place that feels as if it is your own hole in the wall gem?

Outstanding toasted sub sandwiches that hit the spot with a terrible ambiance- get em' to go.

Love the Tuna toasted - written by someone who is a cold tuna aficionado.  

A perennial spot for picking up weekend picnic pleasers.
author: Robert F.

description:
I'm sure all the sandwiches here are excellent but I'm too addicted to the teriyaki beef to try anything else.  A small sandwich fills me up; the teriyaki/secret sauce is rich.  I ate a large one time and was paralyzed for half the day.

They have a "Best of the Bay" award on their wall from 2001.  Either the owners are too lazy to post more recent awards or food critics have been ignoring this little gem.
author: Kumar D.

description:
One of San Francisco's great unsung pleasures. The same Asian guy has been in there, aging gracefully and constructing delicious, toasted, lightly marinated sandwiches gracefully since time immemorial. First went here with some fraternity brothers up from Los Angeles for the Cal game twenty years ago, and returned most recently in December while in the city with a friend from New York. The turkey subs were exactly the same, which is to say very tasty..very good.

The only thing that's changed in the place in the last fifteen years is that they removed the small portable TV that used to sit on the small counter space. Those submitting less than glowing reviews might be mistaking this place with the other Viking Subs outlet. Go to the one on Lombard and watch this man weave his magic. As my old work buddy once told him while enjoying a sandwich there sometime in the late 80s .. "you, sir, are an artist.."
author: R M.

description:
I have been going here for 7 years and the turkey sand is my favorite! Toasted lightly and very flavorful its always a great sandwich. Best to take to go, since the little shop can get blazzing at times, unless its a cold rainy SF day eat in.
Prices are good and staff is quick and friendly.
A must try when in SF.
author: Elisa L.

description:
This crowd-less cozy hole in the wall hit the spot on Black Friday. Although parking is a pain-in-the-ass on Lombard Street, I didn't have to wake up at 5am or make a mad dash to the deli counter to get a satisfying Teriyaki sandwich. However, when you order, hold the rubbery provolone and order a different kind of cheese.

With all the traffic that passes by this lil sandwich shop on the corner of Lombard and Van Ness it's easy to miss. It should have a Las Vegas-sized neon sign inviting you for lunch. It's that good.
author: BrYan W.

description:
This is me, hunched over my turkey & avocado toasted sub sandwich that is just dripping with awe-some-ness. Shh. Don't speak. No, don't.

My intense mastication of this sublime sub has put me into a trance so that now even the dirt smudges on the walls are to be viewed as "artistic genius" & the dusty palm fronds poking into my head from the too-closely potted plant is now just felt as "stimulating".  

"WHOOSH!" the wave of wind & grime through the open door  from a passing semi-truck on Lombard has blown back my hair & tossed a mayo-dripped paper napkin onto my lap & awakened me from my reverie. God-am, what a rush!

Some days I get an urgent craving for Viking & nothing. NOTHING will satisfy until I sate myself with a Turkey/Avo.

the owner always recognizes me & says, "Long time, no see."

Good Christ, won't he hurry up & stop talking & shove a sandwich into my mouth which I hold open, like a baby bird.  Oh! Give it to me. Just like that. Oh!
author: Erika v.

description:
Loved this place!  I was cruising around the city, lookin' for something to eat, and really not wanting a chain restaurant or a super touristy place.  All of a sudden I saw this place, checked yelp to see what folks had to say about it (and what I should order).  THANK YOU YELP!
First of all, the ambiance is everything I love. simple (nothing on the walls, one table with some chairs, and a bar), kinda rustic (or maybe not so clean and pristine) and totally awesome.  This seems like the kind of place that is a real secret...and now I know!
I had read something about a teriyaki beef on yelp, but I opted for the chicken option.  Im glad I had checked yelp, because this sandwich was soooo good. Wow. some sort of dark meat chicken, cooked in this sauces that was kind of bbq-y with a bit of a ginger bite.  really tasty.  once the chicken had cooked a bit in the special oven, the sandwich was assembled and placed back in the oven with all of the fixins, including the cheese.  I think I saw something about BBQ chicken, which I may have to try next time.
Reading some other reviews, I noticed that a lot of people seemed to be bothered by the lack of options. and i think that is exactly why i like this place.  in a world of starbucks, subway, and burger king, I will gladly accept the simplicity of this great sandwich shop.
**The only reason I did not give it 5 stars is because it was a bit pricey...about $10 for a small sandwich and an iced tea.  It wont stop me from going back, but it was the one slightly negative part of the visit.
author: meg p.

description: Good solid delicious toasted submarine sandwich eatery that existed before quiznos even existed. Classic place that has been around for years. Support this awesome mom and pop establishment.
author: Gary Y.

description:
really really good!!! I just wish sandwich places would do portions between the small and the large...small is too small and large is too large!!!!! wtf!!! definitely going there again to try the teriyaki or the bbq one.
a bit pricey as well, it's true...but I think it's totally worth it when you have that sandwich craving!
author: Raimondo P.

description: Definitely a great place to grab a bite to eat. I haven't had a sub this good in a long time. A favorite in my family.
author: Jay S.

description:
My favorite is a turkey and swiss on wheat toast with EVERYTHING!!
Very fresh and great sandwiches.
author: Sandy S.

description:
My wonderful Wifey introduced me to this place one of the best sandwich spots in the city! We go every SATURDAY!!!!! 
Simple place with simple and few options- I love the BBQ sub and the turkey as well!!!!! 
The service is fast and efficient
author: Andrew N.

description: Poor quality for the value. I had heard such rave reviews from the people I know around here that I kept giving it chance after chance, trying different choices from their menu but my initial impression has been confirmed : it is a reasonable sub at very high prices. I simply don't know what other people are seeing/tasting that I'm not. The location is dingy and badly maintained - you won't want to eat there. The couple who run the place are perfectly nice. The subs are fine but subpar if you have ever been to a proper sandwich shop and if you have ever been to a sub shop in New York, you'd never give this place the time of day. Ingredients seem fresh except for the meat. The pre-prepared teriyaki beef and chicken were obviously really, really old - I took two bites and then stopped eating it. The killer is that the prices are really high. $8 for a six inch sub, $10ish for a foot long. Lets be honest, if a Subway or Quizno's was next door, this place would be out of business.
author: Matthew K.

description: Best sandwich ever.... and this coming from someone who doesn't like sandwiches much!  I go out of my way to get a Viking Sub... even drive around the block 10 times until that 10 minute spot becomes available!    I can never choose between the amazing crab salad the the bomb ass turkey w/ avocado.  This is my absolute favorite sandwich shop and every time I go in there, the lady tells me I'm pretty!!  I get a great sandwich AND an ego boost!
author: Atalanta J.

description:
i like this place !
Simple hole in the wall that makes a " Great Toasted Sub "
This place do -- Toasting --- to the right Crisp-ness everytime .
Always a Crunch when you take a bite !
author: Roy L.

description: Total hole in the wall, very unassuming appearance from the street.  Great toasted sandwiches that hit the spot after walking the neighborhood.  $10 minimum for credit card purchases.
author: P M.

description: Delicious Sandwich! Went with the Pastrami, Trukey and Ham. Thought I was going to be in store for an average sandwich as I saw the lady preparing the sando. I think after popping it in the toaster something magical happened and it became a delicious mouth watering sub. I also went with the maccaroni salad, which was also delish.
author: John S.

description: I'm craving for their sandwiches right now & wish I still lived in SF so I could get one anytime. Their sandwiches are just the best! I absolutely love their toasty & warm bread and the sauce.
author: Caro S.

description:
OVERRRRATED.....and overpriced.

Bread is great.

BUT the meat is so thin it's non-existent. And the veggie sandwiches are so bland they remind me of an airport in Ohio.
author: Shannon M.

description: Although high in calories, getting a sandwich here, is a treat for me.  My favorite is the teriyaki beef sandwich. I've tried the chicken teriyaki, but the beef is my favorite.  The beef is tender (no fat or gristle), and enough to get beef in every bite.
author: Lois L.

description: There's really not much to this place, but for some reason the subs are amazing.  There must be a leprachaun or something in the oven that gives these subs an extra level of deliciousness because I think the ingredients are mostly oscar meyer-style meats and kraft cheese...
author: Craig E.

description:
decently  toasted white bread

nicely melted cheese

admirably charred 

properly amount of fillings 

peppery tabasco sauce............

is an emergence of a suitable sandwich for me at this humble place.
author: Nelle A.

description: This place rocked my socks off.  Awesome toasted subs.  I walked into this place after being recommended here by my bro in law.  I got the hot pastrami and I like it too much to try anything else.  I've eaten here for lunch yesterday and today and would probably eat here every day if I was always able to work from home.  Also, when you place your order, you better tell them if there is anything you don't want as they don't ask you how to prepare it along the way.  I happen to love that but it might be a surprise for some picky eaters.
author: John S.

description: This was a pretty awesome find thise weekend.  We stumbled uponthis place because first cup was closing.  I was beyond starving so I needed something quickly.  We turned the corner on lombard and there it was.  I had a toasted pastrami which was to die for.  Now in reading other people's reiews I should have added jalepenos. Oh well, next time.  They have a delicious mayo dressing they put on there too which really adds to the flavor.  I actually really don't like toasted subs but this place and First Cup are the exceptions.
author: Kirsten M.

description: The sandwiches are really good, but can be a little pricey. I've come here on several occasions to get a quick bite, and to my surprise the first time the portion of the sandwiches served were so small. I would like to see them serve larger portions and I would definitely go back more often!
author: Amy C.

description:
Seriously $11 for a mediocre sandwich......i mean it's pretty goood but it still left me hungry... and what is with the mayonaise dressing...YUCK!!!

Dressing left a bad taste in my mouth....I had to go get a slice of pizza at Escape from NEw york after t osatisfy my hunger
author: Crum B.

description: I got the Teriyaki beef sandwich and thought it was super yummy, but my bf thought it was too sweet.  The cheese just melted in my mouth and not in my hands.  My only complaint is that ordering and making the sandwiches take a while.  Oh, and a large sandwich costs $9.95...kind of steep.  BUT, the sandwich is THAT good.
author: Annie S.

description: Decent turkey and avocado sub. A little bit on the pricey side, but not surprising considering it's located in the marina !!
author: S S.

description: I love this sandwich shop that has the subsandwich down pat! The toasted subs here are worth checking out! The mighty viking is my favorite, but everything I tried was awesome! I wish they had this in San Jose!
author: Chris A.

description:
the bread is what sets this place apart and gains it the extra star.  it's good like many other places that i love, but the bread definitely is the compelling event here.

shared a teriyaki and a bbq beef sandwich, and sat at one of the small tables inside.  

for the mere food alone, this place would earn a 5.  however the sandwich prices are a little on the steep side, and a little on the smallish side, so i would give this place a 4.  but needless to say, i will definitely come back here.  it's a winner.
author: Jason J.

description: I like to consider myself a connoisseur of sandwiches and Viking's is one of my personal favorites!!  I am so thankful that it is only a block and half from my house because the Mighty Viking is a little slice of heaven.  When it comes to sandwiches I am a turkey gal all the way.  However, my roommate recommended I try the mighty viking.  WOW!!! I would never get a sandwich with salami, pastrami and ham, but at Viking's it is all I will ever get.  It is pure genius and it melts in your mouth.  The guy who owns the place is super nice as well!!  Do yourself a favor and travel to the corner of Lombard and Van Ness for the best damn sandwich this side of the Mississippi.
author: Jennifer P.

description: Woah, the toasted turkey with avocado rocks! Thanks to fellow Yelpers Plug and Andrew for the great suggestion. Viking's Giant Subs is located in a touristy stretch of Lombard (ok, is there a non touristy stretch?), but, well worth the visit. There are only a few tables here, so I'd recommend following T-Bone's advice by taking a sub to go and heading to Crissy Field. Maybe you'll even run into T-Bone eating her special sub there...
author: Neil K.

description: One of the best toasted subs in the city. An absolute favorite in my book. It's off the chain. Eat up, fatties!
author: David D.

description: I make a trip to Vikings about 15 to 20 times a year. I've grown up around Vikings and in recent years I've grown to love it just as much as my parents. Toasted subs are great. Although it's a little pricey it's definitely worth the price. Living in the city of San Francisco it's hard to find great sandwiches especially at Mom & Pops stores. The bread and the fact that their toasted subs are probably what makes them taste sooo good! The owners are great people too! I love Vikings
author: Sia P.

description:
decent sandwich, but nothing to write home about.

come to think of it, I was totally loaded, and that didn't seem to make a difference (and usually everything's tasty when hammered).

come to think of it again, we went to Bobo's about 30 minutes after inhaling their little sub....then things got better
author: david s.

description: I have only been here once because I'm not in the area that often, but from what I remember, the sandwiches were pretty delicious.  The shop is small, but it's clean and the sandwiches are relatively cheap for what you get.  I got a turkey and avocado sandwich with provolone cheese melted on top and it was dynomite! I was working on a photoshoot that lasted all day and the sandwich helped me get through the day and even left me with enough for dinner!
author: Jade L.

description: These subs are truly the best sandwiches in town.  I've been eating them for five or so years and still consider this hole in the wall a destination eatery (for take-out food!).  The potato salad is really good, too.
author: Marc A.

description: Yum.  Very good sandwiches for a pretty reasonable price.
author: Monika M.

description: I feel like Yelpers totally overhyped this one. It was good but nowhere near as amazing as everyone claimed. Just good. That's it. I'd rather have Lucca's any day of the week. I'd prefer Cheese Shop, AG Ferrari, I think even Mollie Stones sandwiches. Nothing special here folks as far as I can tell. We had the turkey avocado and the salami with pepperoncinis. Eh.
author: Sarah R.

description: I am one of those guys that is always disappointed when something is recommended to me. I guess my expectations are too high when I go in to a place with expectations. With that being said, this place was rec commended to me by a friend, who said it was a great sub shop. I find it to be an OK sub place. The food is decent, but nothing to write home about. In short, it is a step above Subway, but probably not worth the extra cost.
author: Jonathan M.

description: Grab a Viking special sub and join me at Crissy Field for an afternoon.  We will have a good time.
author: T-Bone L.

description: Went with the Turkey & Avacado like most recommended and left a little happier than I arrived. I seem to love just about any toasted subs, but they aren't just your avg sub shop - they know what they are doing fo sho.
author: Mike C.

description: Big yummy sandwiches, not the best ever, but still very good. The place is kind of a whole in the wall, but it has character.  Worth a try if you like sandwiches...who doesn't?
author: Nilu r.

description:
my favorite sandwich place in the city. the toasty goodness with oil and spices and mayonnaise makes it a drippy mess, but well worth it.

I always get the turkey with avocado and swiss and am never disappointed.
author: Jenny R.

description: Hail mighty Viking...this sandwich was really good, if not a bit drippy with mayo. This would be a great place to grab a snack before heading over the Golden Gate bridge to Sonoma and beyond. My only gripe...9 bucks...but it was good, and you can park right in front, they have a "green zone" (10 minutes)
author: James S.

description:
i just can't get comfortable spending $15 for a turkey sandwich with an arizona iced tea.

if you can, you'll enjoy the sandwich.  i'd caution you about letting smear on their usual amount of mayo... they probably refill the squeeze bottle every half an hour.  

the two things that make the sandwich stand out is the toastiness... just slightly blackened on the top to get the right crunchiness.  And the dressing dolloped on at the end.  a little oily, but darn tasty.

For 15 bones, i'd prefer a tri tip sandwich for a steak joint.
author: Kevin F.

description:
Great sandwich place ! 

I come here at least once a week; sandwiches are always delicious, and very filling.
author: Ilyia K.

description:
Order the Mighty Viking.

This is the only place I can drop $9 on a sandwich and be happy about it.  The sandwich is SOOOOO good.

Not much to speak of inside.  Service is nice and efficient.  But the Mighty Viking is TASTY!
author: Chris F.

description: You think you can't really screw up a simple turkey sub (grinder for the Northeast Peeps), but you can.  But Viking doesn't.  I've had the simple turkey sub with lettuce, tomato, cheese and mayo a few times and haven't been disappointed yet.  I even tried to re-create it at home, but somehow managed to not even come close.  I swear they do something magical to make something so simple so good.  Next time I'll try the Turkey Avocado like the other reviewers mentioned.
author: Mrsdubyah W.

description:
3 star sandwich. 

Tough to complain; tougher to get excited.

+ Toasted sesame seeds, bunch of avocado, good ingredient mix

- Very average sandwich, all things considered.
author: r g.

description: This place is truly a hidden gem, in that you will likely not walk past it since it sits on a fairly low walking traffic corner.  The subs are delicous and made to order.  Not a place for those counting calories, you might want to keep walking up to Subway.  The Turkey sub is excellent.  The place is cash only, so bring a Hamilton.
author: Aashish T.

description: This place is the bomb!! Get either the chicken or beef teriyaki. Once you munch on the sandwich, you'll be begging for more. Something about the toasted bread and sauce, I think they use crack sauce lol. Use to cut school (G-House) just to go there to eat and watch TV!! The owners are always nice and corteous Now, workin in Frisco again, whenever I drive in, you know where I be at!! 5 stars!!
author: Jay G.

description: Highly addictive.  The taste of crisped sesame seeds atop oven toasted buns flash before me, bringing back memories of the gooey warm perfection that could and will be mine.  Nothing better on a rainy day.
author: Madama M.

description: How about the large meatball sandwhich?  Its like a meal!  All toasty and warm, and plenty of meatballs, cheese and good sauce!  My friends come from out of town and always want to go here, as I live around the corner!
author: Duane T.

description: although it looks dirty from the outside, this place makes some good delicious sammiches.  the mighty viking, the hot pastrami (add avocados!), and the meatball sandwich are my favorites.
author: thien t.

description: They need to have a location in San Diego!! One of the best places for a sub...Still to this day the same type of sandwich....tastes soooo gooooood....there is no way anyone can make a replica of a fine sandwich such as vikings....parkin is tough, but well worth the walk...you have to go to vikings, PERIOD!!!
author: Ketan P.

description: This place is a great neighborhood sub place.  Its pretty small and not that charming, but they have great sandwiches.
author: Richard C.

description: This place is literally a whole in the wall type of place own by a Korean couple. They are super nice and well interior of the place I cant is all that great but man oh man are their subs so good. I would come back any day for one.
author: J L.

description: I'm not a big fan of eating sandwiches at restaurants, but I'll always give a sandwich that's "hot and toasted" a try.  I was truly surprised by how good my sandwich was.  My boyfriend ordered A BLT during the week and commented that it probably THE best BLT he's ever had and I was like yeah right, whatever.  So I stopped by the next week and ordered a pastrami and ham with swiss cheese and WOW, great stuff.  He has this oven that heats the bread to a crispy covering on the outside, but warm and soft on the inside, and the oven really mixes all of the ingredients on the sandwich really well.  I don't how to describe it.  Let's just say it was magic!  Ha! I'd give this place 5 stars, but I went back for the same sandwich and the owner guy put too many onions on there, which turned me off.  I'll definitely go back, but something has to be said for consistency.  I've got to be able to count on the sandwich in my time of hunger and need....The only other thing is don't order the small if you're really hungry.  It fills me up, but the men-folk would probably want a bit more.
author: LaSha G.

description: turkey and avocado...to go.  so good, all the toppings, fast and toasty!  definitely a great place to catch a quick bite on the go.
author: Lauren V.

description: the toasting of the bread is the key here.  their teriyaki beef sandwich is pretty awesome.
author: Jonny L.

description: Was expecting a lot more based on the reviews.  I got the small sub ($10 for a large sub is way too much), and it was barely 6 inches long, and very light on the meat.  I was not impressed and will not be going back.
author: Ethan K.

description: This place makes the best sandwiches in the city! The bread is delicious. Toasting of the sandwich is great.  I always find parking right in front of the place, but i tend to never go during the usual lunch hour.  I have yet to try all their sandwiches, but everyone I've tried has been so yummy. Everyone I've taken there has always been impressed!  Can't wait for the next time i go there.
author: Linda H.

description: i moved to seattle in 1999.  i moved back this year (2005).  i visited the bay area while i was gone a few times, and always came back to visit this spot when i was able to.  i would do a sandwich tour, going to molinari's for their hot salami, vito's in piedmont for a combo (sadly vito retired a few years ago, and the place is now gone.  no one puts the hot wax peppers [preferrably bruno's] on their combo anywhere else.  wake up people!  [ed. note: genova delicatessen at 51st and Telegraph in Oakland does]), and truly med for a shwarma (i know, not exactly a sandwich, but close enough and damn tasty).  anyway, viking's on lombard: the same guy is still there after all these years (like arthur dent), rocking the toasted sesame roll with turkey and avocado. i never get anything else, so i can't say what else is good, but apparently the BLT comes recommended.  basically, all you want in a sandwich shop: good ingredients, no fancy complications, and a sandwich maker that quietly puts the care into it that makes it perfect.  only problem?  closest newspaper is a block away.
author: Plug N.

description: i give this place 3 stars because it's overpriced. sure the subs are pretty damn good but seriously - i walked out of there spending at least $17 dollars. on what? a sub, drink and chips maybe? it's a mom and pop shop and it's sf so i can't be too mad about the price of these subs. great place to grab something if you're hungover...
author: Miss O.
